column4: I just ran df -h and it showed /home using 3.3 gigs, so I deleted to Linux .iso files, which should have freed up 1.4 gig, but df -h still shows 3.3 gigs?
no kidding, df -h list them both.
: that≈õ strange...should be free up some size if you have already delete some iso files at your home dir
yes, that's what I thought too. I ran updatedb too, but that didn't seem to do anything at all?
: try locate what files taking large space of your HDD
I did, they were the two ~700 mb .iso files that I deleted.
it's simple! I haven't emptied my trash folder!!
I'm now at 1.9 gig, so I could dump my entire /home directory onto Dropbox, for off sight backup.
: yeah its good plan to have backup :beer:
: got slow line here , i just dump my /home to external HDD
roger that, doing pretty much the same thing here, using grsync between to boxes on the LAN.
